intro: Hyptis subsessilis, commonly known as Mexican mint marigold, is a perennial herb native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is characterized by its aromatic, square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental and medicinal gardens. Hyptis subsessilis is also valued for its essential oils, which are used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine.
